intro: Stellera pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent starwort, is a perennial herb native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine pubescence. Stellera pubescens typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
